document.description: Philadelphia food and restaurant news, restaurant reviews and restaurant listings from ... Prism Brewing has a jukebox, a couple TVs, some arcade games. You can order from ...

Exclusive interactive map Find a farmer's market Platter of the Clam Bar's crunchy, golden-fried scallops, shrimp, flounder, clam strips, and crab cake. Where are hot new restaurants? LaBan's 4 Bell restaurants CRAIG LaBAN REVIEWS Shore Dining, Part 2: Classics Posted
07/06/2012 Craig LaBan is thankful for the Jersey Shore classics - both revived and still thriving - but is disappointed by newer high-end options. Shore Dining, Part 1: Revel Posted
06/27/2012 Craig LaBan checks out the star-chef eateries and ambitious cuisine. Here’s some advice on where to place your bets. Chat | Columns | Year in Bells PHILLY.COM/FOOD Pop go the gourmet popsicles Jason Wilson with a cold hard fact: These are the latest in handheld treats. Jason Wilson columns RESTAURANT INSIDER MICHAEL KLEIN Cavanaugh's to take over Dark Horse Change in Society Hill. The Insider: Amber Rose to plug vodka here The Insider: Heart surgery forces temporary shutdown of 943 The Insider: Is Food in Jars' logo being ripped off? PHILLY.COM/FOOD Zea May serving up Native-American flavors Truck Stop: Don't miss out. Zea May's Kitchen has sandwiches, salads and snacks with a Native-American influence. Expect ingredients such as corn, quinoa, wild rice and even bison. More "Truck Stop" » CHAIN GANG Taco Bell upscales with Cantina line Chain: Taco Bell.Company description: This burrito is part of Taco Bell's new Cantina line, which the company describes thusly: "Chef Lorena Garcia created Taco Bell's new Cantina Bell Menu by using bold and flavorful ingredients, including guacamole, citrus-herb marinated chicken, and freshly prepared pico de gallo." Nutritional info: 760 calories, 27 grams of fat, 1,960 mg of sodium. More "Chain Gang" » NEW RESTAURANTS Mike's Map of Restaurant Openings Catching up with Christopher Kearse Afternoon Snacks PHILLY.COM/FOOD NoBL brings Mediterranean flavor to Lansdowne Birra adds Barra in Old City Le Bec-Fin opens Tuesday MORE RESTAURANT NEWS Recipes with a legacy Single challenge: Cooking for one Wet and wild summer cocktail trends Craig LaBan's online chat Gallery: La Petite Dauphine, in photos My Daughter's Kitchen: Vietnamese-Style Rice Noodle Salad City Paper Times new ramen Philadelphia gets a taste of the noodle dish. Catching up with Christopher Kearse With collaboration dinners and a burgeoning BYOB on Passyunk, chef Christopher Kearse has been busy since City Paper last spoke... Afternoon Snacks Dueling lobsters, crack your own crabs, and milkshakes with a kick. Yards hosts The Dude Hates Cancer Yards hosts a night of Lebowski-style revelry in support of The Dude Hates Cancer complete with DIPA and food trucks. Restaurants Pop go the gourmet popsicles Jason Wilson with a cold hard fact: These are the latest in handheld treats. Books, brews and other activities Joe Sixpack: There's something for everyone on tap this summer. Shore Dining, Part 2: Classics Craig LaBan is thankful for the Jersey Shore classics - both revived and still thriving - but is disappointed by newer high-end options. A stroke of snack-food genius V For Veg: Olympic rowers will officially be powered by a vegan product. Recipes with a legacy Heirloom restaurant recently hosted its first Heirloom Fine American Cookery recipe contest. The competition was inspired by heirloom recipes that channel a food and love connection. Single challenge: Cooking for one It can be a lonely challenge; it can also be a comforting, creative pastime. Here's advice from those who go solo. Wet and wild summer cocktail trends Carbonated cocktails in a bottle, punch bowls for sharing, and updated tiki drinks are the new pours this summer, as the cocktail scene in local restaurants and bars continues to keep pace with the city’s food revolution. Craig LaBan's online chat Here is an excerpt from Craig LaBan's online chat: Craig LaBan: Just got a chance to visit the barely year-old Dad's Hat Distillery in Bristol (see this coming Sunday's Drink column) which just launched its barrel-aged rye in the Pennsylvania market (along with its already available white rye). If you're really curious, Dad's distillery is inaugurating its open-to-the-public Saturdays this weekend with tours, tastings, and on-site sales thanks to the smart new Pennsylvania law allowing for on-site sales at craft distilleries, similar to wineries and breweries. Gallery: La Petite Dauphine, in photos My Daughter's Kitchen: Vietnamese-Style Rice Noodle Salad Here is an excerpt from the blog "My Daughter's Kitchen." From the time my children were in grade school, their favorite takeout dinner, hands down, was the vermicelli noodles and chicken topped with spring rolls from Vietnam Restaurant in Chinatown. I don't mean to suggest that they were super adventurous eaters, because they weren't. But my husband used to bring home this dinner for the two of us, and soon enough the kids wanted to taste what their parents were eating. Shortly thereafter, they wanted Styrofoam containers of their own. Agave with your coffee? Finally...a way to enjoy agave without the hangover. That's right, agave nectar is made from the same plant used to produce tequila. Eats Beat: Dining Days University City Dining Days, a/k/a "3 courses, 3 prices," lets you sample your way around a booming dining scene for $15, $25 or $30 today through July 26. Get $7 parking at 38th or 40th and Walnut garages with restaurant validation. More at ucdiningdays.com.The Philadelphia Museum of Art, now hosting the "Craft Spoken Here" exhibit, looks at "Hostess Crafting" with farm-to-table dining pioneer Aimee Olexy, from 3-5 p.m. Saturday? in the Pearlman Building Gallery Cafe. $40, 215-684-7990, philamuseum.org. Parc (227 S. 18th St., 215-545-2262) opened on July 14, 2008. The French bistro celebrates its 4th birthday and Bastille Day this weekend with special dishes and drinks, and an accordion player. Eastern State Penitentiary (2027 Fairmount Ave., 215-236-5111, easternstate.org) celebrates Bastille Day with the experimental cabaret troupe the Bearded Ladies, starting at 4:30 p.m. Saturday. Things come to a, er, head as Marie Antoinette (a/k/a Terry McNally, co-owner of London Grill and Paris Wine Bar) is carried off, but not before throwing 3,000 Tastykakes to the rabble. Taco Bell upscales with Cantina line Chain: Taco Bell.Company description: This burrito is part of Taco Bell's new Cantina line, which the company describes thusly: "Chef Lorena Garcia created Taco Bell's new Cantina Bell Menu by using bold and flavorful ingredients, including guacamole, citrus-herb marinated chicken, and freshly prepared pico de gallo." Nutritional info: 760 calories, 27 grams of fat, 1,960 mg of sodium. Gallery: Seafood Unlimited's new mosaic Recipe: Agave-Barbecue Roasted Chicken 3- to 5-pound whole chickenKosher salt and ground black pepper For the barbecue sauce: NoBL brings Mediterranean flavor to Lansdowne Table Talk: Early crowds are finding ambition in Lansdowne at the gorgeous NoBL, a Mediterranean BYOB that opened last week. Cheese of the Month: Manouri It's like ricotta salata's Greek cousin, a cheery white cylinder of sheep's milk cheese made from the whey left over from feta production Olympic-sized reprimand for Philly eatery A Greek restaurant at the Reading Terminal is being forced to drop the word "Olympic" from its name. Two cool popsicle recipes Here are two cool and delicious popsicle recipes you can try at home from Jeanne Chang at Lil Pop Shop in West Philly. Easy as ... cobbler Put pie away for summer: Crisps and crumbles and cobblers are such simple ways to put your best fruit forward. Recipe: Blueberry Cobbler Recipe: Basic Buttermilk Dough Recipe: Individual Sour Cherry (Summer Fruit) Crumbles Recipe: Basic Crisp Topping Recipe: Apricot Shortcake Crisp Recipe: Spaghetti alla Carbonara Recipe: Apple Maple Bread Pudding Recipe: Steak Salad Recipe: Mustard and Ginger Dressing (for Steak Salad) Recipe: Linguine with Smoked Salmon Sauce Shore Dining, Part 1: Revel Craig LaBan checks out the star-chef eateries and ambitious cuisine. Here’s some advice on where to place your bets. Cheap Buzz: Gin drinking's easy in the summertime BUZZ: It's summertime again, so everybody's drinking gin-and-tonics. Ugh. Why anybody would drink something that smells like Pine-Sol is beyond me. Makes me queasy just thinking about it. Marnie: Believe it or not, Buzz, modern gin traces its roots to a 17th-century Dutch remedy for upset stomachs, among other ailments. Alcoholic tinctures of botanical ingredients were common medicines. Juniper berries were thought to help kidney problems, gallstones and the gout, too. Great beer is a state of mind Joe Sixpack: On "island time" a cold bottle of Heineken is the best beer in the world. Pork&beans, always a cute couple But they play the field a lot, too, getting into sassy or sweet sauces, or even a salad. This pair was made to be fiddled with. Scallops With Thai-Scented Pea Puree Let's face it, sometimes dinner comes down to what's in the freezer. With a bag of Trader Joe's scallop, a bag of frozen peas and 20 minutes, you have a fabulous, easy dinner. Hot diggity: Philly's best dogs The once-humble hot dog is on a roll. Here's a guide to some of the top dogs, old-school and upscale. Mini-meals done organic Family-loving Food Network chef Tyler Florence has rolled out a line of organic, easy-to-prepare, yummy packaged food for the wee set (from babes to toddlers) called Sprout. Eats Beat: 5/7/12 Eats Beat: All things blueberry will be honored at the Blueberry Bash summer festival at Terhune Orchards. Culinary gift from a great grandmom Elizabeth Gilbert found a treasure in her great-gran's recipe book. Written in 1947 by Margaret Yardley Potter, a well-heeled socialite raised in refined Chestnut Hill, the book offers recipes folded into tart pose. Build uncommonly fine burgers Fresh grinding, blending of prime cuts yield today's perfect, pricey patties. FIND A RESTAURANT FIND A RECIPE
